many Thanks

Hi Daniel,

Could you point out in which step described in ""How-to-develop-eRCP-Apps-on-Eclipse.pdf" induces this problem?

Sorry, that document is stale since stand-alone RCP style apps have not been our focus since  incorporating the workbench style application model.

Here is what I do to run ercpHello

Get Eclipse 3.2
Get eRCP M9
In a new workspace, change Target Platform to point to the win32 version of M9
Change to the CVS repository perspective, check out ercpHello from /home/dsdp
Edit ercpHello.properties to personalize the title string
Create new Run configuration for "Eclipse Application"
Set application to ercpHello and click Run
ercpHello starts with title string personalized

traces.message: Application "org.eclipse.ercp.example.ercpHello.ercpHello" could not be found in the registry. The applications available are: <NONE>.
